description: Change of use from Use Class E(g)(i) Offices to three self-contained flat (Use Class C3) (Class MA, 56-day Prior Approval Process)
application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
decision_conditions: Development must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.

Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (5) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended). | The building permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse by virtue of Class MA shall remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 1 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.

Reason: In accordance with Condition MA.2. (6) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:

1KS- 113: EXISTING AND PROPOSED THIRD FLOOR PLAN; 1KS- 112:EXISTING AND PROPOSED SECOND FLOOR PLAN; 1KS- 102: PROPOSED BLOCK PLAN BIN AND BIKES; 1KS- 110: EXISTING AND PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN; 1KS- 101: Site Plan; 1KS-111:EXISTING AND PROPOSED FIRST FLOOR PLAN ; 1KS-101: EXISTING BLOCK PLAN BIN AND BIKES; 1KS-152 : BIN STORE ROOF PLAN AND REAR ELEVATIONS; 1KS-151:BIN STORE PLAN AND ELEVATIONS; 1KS-150:CYCLE STORE PLAN AND ELEVATIONS;

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The cycle storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle storage, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse storage shown in the approved drawings listed under condition 3 shall be brought into use prior to first occupation of the flat and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure adequate refuse storage in accordance with Policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from commercial/ industrial/ cultural/transport sources, incl. activities associated with the surrounding commercial premises and markets, and reflected and re-radiated noise where appropriate, occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays.

Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) to achieve internal noise limits specified in SPG10.
Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve criteria of BS8233:2014.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating commercial premises from dwellings, by at least 10dB/ 15dB/ 20dB, as necessary above the Building Regulations value for residential use based on proposed use and noise emissions. Where commercial noise emissions include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level shall not exceed NR20 Leq (5mins) inside habitable rooms. Details shall include the installation method and materials of separating structures and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound levels. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10
